posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
EliHarel wrote:My thought was that even with the +8 AC of the Towershield the overall AC will still be too low to really avoid the attacks of the monsters he'll go against, so might as well go for more damage.
Well, 8 AC makes a huge difference, as I said. Of course if the AB-AC of your enemies (their AB vs your AC that is) is 28+ then it makes no difference since they would miss you only on a 1 shield or not. That is not usually the case (but I don't know about Arelith) hence +8 AC will, in all likelihood, make you to be hit a lot less often.

FYI the guy has 30 mundane AC. With a buffing cleric with travel and plant domains (or anyhow access to cleric buffs+barkskin+haste/mass haste) that figure becomes 54, to which you can add +1 from mage armor, +5 from a bard song and +3 from dodge boots (you said you can get +3 gear right?) going up to 63. Consider that you have +1 AC vs the current target and +4 AC vs all attacks of opportunity too. You also can use expertise for a further +5 AC. So we are looking potentially at 68 AC which can further be capped by stacking MA with the shadow MA up to the dodge cap (another +7 dodge AC).

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
EliHarel wrote:I'm not yet qualified to take RDD, PM and shifter in Arelith, for which this build is intended.

1. What I meant to ask Kail was for the avantages of the Bard version over the Rogue, because I didn't see anything all too worthwhile. The rogue's sneaks seem useful with IK, I get more fighter levels for more feats. I don't see why the Bardsong is worth that?
2. The scimitar + towershield for good AC and frequent crits is very appealing. Does it matter whether I choose Rapier or Scimitar? And is there another one handed weapon that's better yet for a WM?
3. As far as I understand, the 16 WM is just for +2 AB to the favored weapon. Correct me if I'm wrong, but from 7 WM to 16 WM, the only difference is +2 AB. That seems a lot for 9 levels. Shouldn't I put them in Fighter for more feats?
4. Versatility in weaponry: is it recommended to take an additional Favored Weapon in some two-handed weapon for more damage, or maybe go for improved two weapon fighting and wield two scimitars/rapiers with every second hit a critical?
5. Is Appraise any good?
1- It's not. Rogue is better.

2- It does if you have access to Keen Edge scrolls, which only work on Slashing weapons. Otherwise, no.

3- You get a bonus feat at WM 13 and another one at WM 16, but I wouldn't underestimate 2 AB. If you're worried about heavy investments, don't go for WM, but you already got SO MUCH IN, all those feats, 4 skill ranks in intimidate, to get only 7 levels. Might as well make use of that class to raise your AB, since the ONLY REASON you'd want more feats is because you're spending so many of them in WM requirements.

4- No. It's not worth it to dual wield Scimitars and Rapiers because they're medium weapons, which means you receive a -4 penalty to all attacks and that's not good.

5- Depends on servers. I find that it's good in places where you can buy very expensive items (like a bow that costs 900.000 GPs), cuz it makes stuff that you sell give more gold.

EliHarel wrote:I'm not yet qualified to take RDD, PM and shifter in Arelith, for which this build is intended.

1. What I meant to ask Kail was for the avantages of the Bard version over the Rogue, because I didn't see anything all too worthwhile. The rogue's sneaks seem useful with IK, I get more fighter levels for more feats. I don't see why the Bardsong is worth that?
Rogue offers, in addition to what' sin common with bard (tumble and umd mostly) SA, evasion, more skillpoints and classed trap skills (and OL). Bard instead has classed taunt and spellcraft and a weak bardsong (at 6th lvl +1 AB, +2 dmg, +1 saves and +1 skills). Spellcraft and taunt ain't bad at all, but whether it's worthwhile or not depends on the player's preference.
2. The scimitar + towershield for good AC and frequent crits is very appealing. Does it matter whether I choose Rapier or Scimitar? And is there another one handed weapon that's better yet for a WM?
Environment dependent. Scimmy and rapier, as said, differ in damage type and scimmy is keenable. Which one is best for you depends on what's exactly available where you play.
3. As far as I understand, the 16 WM is just for +2 AB to the favored weapon.
And two feats. Also, +2 AB is no "just"; it i spretty meaningful and alters significantly the dmg output per round.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but from 7 WM to 16 WM, the only difference is +2 AB. That seems a lot for 9 levels. Shouldn't I put them in Fighter for more feats?
Do you need more feats? (at most you get +2 feats btw) More than you need +2 AB (equivalent to a further EWF)?
4. Versatility in weaponry: is it recommended to take an additional Favored Weapon in some two-handed weapon for more damage
40 lvls and Arelith leveling rules leave little space for that route which wants feats; you'd probably be forced to indeed stop at WM 7 in that case. A second WoC could be heavy flail, because it's 2-handed blunt damage.
or maybe go for improved two weapon fighting and wield two scimitars/rapiers with every second hit a critical?
Bad idea, although if you wanna do that for style points (which is entirely subjective and too much affected by a certain drow character I'd say) a high AB like that granted by heavy WM helps (since you get a further -2 AB compared to "proper" dual wielding, because of the non small size of the offhand weapon).
5. Is Appraise any good?
Module dependent, is it any good on Arelith?
